revised_title: Oscillatory Ignitions and Cool Flames in Acetaldehyde Oxidation: A Study in a Well-Stirred, Continuous-Flow Reactor
tldr: This study investigates the oscillatory ignitions and cool flames accompanying the non-isothermal oxidation of acetaldehyde in a well-stirred, continuous-flow reactor. The researchers observed nine chemically and physically distinct stable modes of reaction, including seven types of stable oscillations and two stationary states. They mapped the conditions for each mode on an ignition diagram and found unprecedented variety in the behavior of the reaction.
